replies.body: Welp, this sucks.  Item sets is actually a super important feature and the only reason I've been using legacy.  There's not even a time line for when we can expect the feature back.  Upgrades are supposed to improve and add features, not take them away.  If the feature parity isn't there between the new and old client, then you shouldn't force the switch yet.
There are third party item set creator tools that work with League that even a Rioter himself recommended. If you want I can link you to the Ask Riot that explains that.
I mean, just the fact that Riot is telling their player base to go to third party websites/apps to create and alter their item sets (which are still a feature in the game) is laughable.
A new client that uses more resources and has less features.  Yay.

Feels even better since it uses what little resources my computer can spare and then some, every time I've tried using the new client it has made me dodge by not being able to pick or ban a champ in time or just crash.

new client lags, old one doesn't 

don't see why we need the new client

Literally Riot Games meeting

"So the new client is unfinished, and we can't release it yet"

"But it's pretty!"

"Yes, but the low spec mode isn't fully working yet, we don't have item sets also."

"pretty"

"Are you even listening? Half of the people can't play League if we do this."

"PRETTY."

"OK FINE. Screw the old client"
April fools was a long time ago.

"Literally none of us want the new client."
"Okay, we're deleting the old client! New client for everybody!"
k
I'm not going to kid myself into thinking that a large amount of people are going to stop playing, just because this is League we're talking about. But I myself am likely going to continue the pattern of playing less and less and less that I've been on.

"Work's not done on the client yet"

....

So why are you releasing it?  Have you not seen what happens in the video game industry when you have an unfinished product?

I'm so excited for the client that has a cruddier PM system, lags even if you have a great, high end computer, and doesn't even maintain features like item sets yet.  Seriously, those "benefits" for the most part are garbage.  I'm all for a new client, but don't force this excuse of a new, improved client on us until you have it polished and done right.  This is basically the Boards all over again.  We're still technically in beta on the Boards and the bugs and lack of certain features are so obvious it's not even funny.

Finish the new client THEN force us on it.

> Finish the new client THEN force us on it.

THANK YOU.
Don't fix what isn't broken..
The fact that there are more negative reactions to this than positive should say a lot about whether this should be implemented or not, you know.
Legacy Client > Shitty Alpha Client
Fuck you.
April 24th is the official quitting of League
RIP Legacy client. You will be missed (mostly because my crappy laptop doesn't run the new client very well, sometimes miss first ban).
riot don't do it

Or just let people keep the old client instead of updating to this slowass shit made for people with fancy computers.
I hate League more and more everyday with every shitty rework, update, and change.
How about letting people refund champs that have been reworked or something else useful?

Features I would like to see in the new client not mentioned in the post:

- Random character button in champ select
- ~~Message of the Day for Clubs~~ (move it somewhere that people can easily see it)
- Public chat rooms
- Difficulty choice for Twisted Treeline Co-op vs AI
- Some way to know Red/Blue side in champ select when playing non-draft modes.
- Being able to see # of games won for other players in post-game lobby


Glad you're listening tho

What a terrible decision. I love the nonchalant explanations too. 

"What if they are things I like about the old client that aren't included in the new one? What if the new client is laggy for me?"

"We completely understand and are taking your feedback seriously... But we are doing it anyway because we also don't really care."

I guess I'll just go f*** myself then. What failed logic and what an inexplicably dumb decision from Riot.

Bullshit, the only reason i currently use the new client is to launch the legacy client. legacy client is more fast, responsive, and reliable. I've had a set of games where the new client would crash my in game loading screen to the point to where i couldn't even play and had to suffer losses bc of a bullshit unfinished product, thats now being forced down my throat.

So what happened to 'We won't replace the old client until the new one is finished'????

We still don't have chat rooms, item sets, resizable window, or half of the performance of the old client

This sucks, you've killed off a whole segment of your community by not making chat rooms a priority, even though they're dead simple to implement (YOU ALREADY HAVE CLUBS IN AND NO ONE USES THEM EXCEPT MEME TAGS). Not to mention clubs have such a low limit of maximum users in them, where Chat rooms capped out at 200(!!!)

Why lie and say you won't replace the old client until the new one is finished? What do you realistically stand to gain from forcing users to use an unfinished, unoptimized client?

You can resize it using cntrl+ and cntrl-

I'm pretty sure you're still mad after learning this but I thought I'd share anyway 

*hides*

Actually ctrl+ and ctrl- _only resize the window to one of the two sizing options_.

#There is no scalable resizing available.

i really don't understand this. the new client doesn't have the item set tool (you haven't even started development on it) which is ridiculous. why not implement the new client after the item set tool is completed - since even you guys say players want it really badly?

further, it's still laggy/buggy/glitchy/slow af, and i see no real benefits of it. draft/ranked = too glitchy/slow sometimes u might miss a ban/pick, blind = load in too slow to ever call ur position.

one of the best things about league was that it runs on all types of toasters and literally everybody can play it without many inconveniences. there was absolutely NOTHING wrong with the old client at all. all it was missing compared to the new one imo is the replay system, and i don't see how they needed a WHOLE NEW CLIENT just to implement a replay system?

srsly riot, just why....?
